Articles.Content:
After the Bismarck I wanted to create a real SSTO Spaceplane Cruiser. I've tried so many engine settings I can't count. Tried Nuclear Engines but they were much too heavy and provided not enough thrust. After 3 days of playing around I went back to the boring aerospikes but it was totally worth it.

No mods were used (including Mechjeb). After the takeoff which was a real horror the rest was pretty easy. I managed to reach a stable orbit with no fuel left, so no pictures with engines on, will need to refuel it first.

Check it out:

Rear views:

Bottom:

Hope you like it. Oh man, how I love this game in such moments...

For those interested, the craft file:

http://www.file-upload.net/download-7533284/Anubis2.craft.html

Edit: Gotta edit this craft a bit. Forgot to add some more RCS-thrusters -.-

Steers very slowly.

Edit 2: Have edited it now. Added 2 nuclear engines, more RCS-thrusters for faster turns and more RCS fuel. Stabilized it at bit, it's easier to take off (but still a hell of a takeoff) - Use RCS for turning up after you left the runway, you can turn it off afterwards.

Added some lights and generators for electricity.

Added control groups:

1 - toggle outter aerospikes

2 - toggle inner aersopikes

3 - toggle nuclear engines

4 - shut down all engines

5 - activate all engines

Images of the "mk2":

Nuclear engine additional to the aerospikes:

Other side, added a tail connector to the nuclear engine and added some swept wings to make up for the additional mass in the back and to stabilize the flight through a slightly lower point of lift (works pretty well):

After leaving the runway (low settings due to potato-computer) - Jonby is sceptical but he made it into space unharmed (klick image to get to the big one, didn't want to detonate this thread):

Yeah! I downloaded it and crashed KSP: memory overrun or something like that.

Note to self: buy better computer, hopefully not a laptop.

Incredible-looking images though, I'm amazed that thing made it to orbit.

Once it's off the runway it performs really good, I was suprised myself (though I tried to balance it as good as possible in this size & design).

The takeoff is by far the hardest part. Full throttle, all engines on, take off with RCS on, slightly pull up, not that much that the wings touch the ground but not too less or you will crash immediately.

Made a new version by now which performs a little bit better, still hard takeoff though, nuclear engines on board, more RCS-thrusters and more RCS-fuel.

P.S.: I got it into orbit befor I postet it of course :-D

Dang. That could be one of the most menacing/cool/scary things I have ever seen in KSP. I think I would abandon ship if that thing was headed for my space station.

Great design!

The takeoff problem is solved by moving the wheels forward so the rearmost set of wheels are near the center of gravity. That's why it doesn't rotate. Also, keep it's acceleration just below 2g (in the green) until about 50km altitude to maximize your fuel. More than 3gs inside the atmosphere is wasted. I personally might have added a few drop off jet engines and filled the center section of engines with thrust vectoring engines, but at the same time, I really like the all aerospike look.
